block.p: Carolyn Joy Dlugatz, a daughter of Linda and Martin Dlugatz of Middletown, N.Y., was married last evening in Woodcliff Lake, N.J., to Steven Hadley Wortman, a son of Shelly Schack of Hollywood, Fla., and Dr. Kenneth Wortman of Coral Springs, Fla. Rabbi Steven Lindemann, a cousin of the bride, officiated at the Woodcliff Lake Hilton.

Mrs. Wortman, 27, is a certified public accountant and the assistant fund controller at Olympus Capital Holdings Asia, an investment fund in New York. She graduated cum laude from Tulane University. Her parents own Gilman's Cleaners, a dry cleaning store in Middletown.

Carolyn Joy Dlugatz, a daughter of Linda and Martin Dlugatz of Middletown, N.Y., was married last evening in Woodcliff Lake, N.J., to Steven Hadley Wortman, a son of Shelly Schack of Hollywood, Fla., and Dr. Kenneth Wortman of Coral Springs, Fla. Rabbi Steven Lindemann, a cousin of the bride, officiated at the Woodcliff Lake Hilton.

Mrs. Wortman, 27, is a certified public accountant and the assistant fund controller at Olympus Capital Holdings Asia, an investment fund in New York. She graduated cum laude from Tulane University. Her parents own Gilman's Cleaners, a dry cleaning store in Middletown.

Mr. Wortman, 29, is a stock analyst at Wynnefield Capital, a hedge fund in New York. He graduated from the University of Florida. His mother is a mental health counselor in Plantation, Fla. His father is a dentist in Tamarac, Fla. The bridegroom is a stepson of Michael Schack and of Laurie Wortman. WEDDINGS/CELEBRATIONS
